TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit StringWriter extends System.IO.TextWriter

Docs.summary: Implements a for writing information to a string. The information is stored in an underlying .

remarks.format:
## Remarks StringWriter enables you to write to a string synchronously or asynchronously. You can write a character at a time with the or the method, a string at a time using the or the method. In addition, you can write a character, an array of characters or a string followed by the line terminator asynchronously with one of the methods. > [!IMPORTANT] > This type implements the interface. When you have finished using the type, you should dispose of it either directly or indirectly. To dispose of the type directly, call its method in a `try` /`catch` block. To dispose of it indirectly, use a language construct such as `using` (in C#) or `Using` (in Visual Basic). For more information, see the “Using an Object that Implements IDisposable” section in the interface topic. The following table lists examples of other typical or related I/O tasks. |To do this...|See the example in this topic...| |-------------------|--------------------------------------| |Create a text file.|[How to: Write Text to a File](../Topic/How%20to:%20Write%20Text%20to%20a%20File.md)| |Write to a text file.|[How to: Write Text to a File](../Topic/How%20to:%20Write%20Text%20to%20a%20File.md)| |Read from a text file.|[How to: Read Text from a File](../Topic/How%20to:%20Read%20Text%20from%20a%20File.md)| |Append text to a file.|[How to: Open and Append to a Log File](../Topic/How%20to:%20Open%20and%20Append%20to%20a%20Log%20File.md)



| |Get the size of a file.|| |Get the attributes of a file.|| |Set the attributes of a file.|| |Determine if a file exists.|| |Read from a binary file.|[How to: Read and Write to a Newly Created Data File](../Topic/How%20to:%20Read%20and%20Write%20to%20a%20Newly%20Created%20Data%20File.md)| |Write to a binary file.|[How to: Read and Write to a Newly Created Data File](../Topic/How%20to:%20Read%20and%20Write%20to%20a%20Newly%20Created%20Data%20File.md)| ## Examples The following code example demonstrates the creation of a continuous paragraph from a group of double-spaced sentences, and then the conversion of the paragraph back to the original text. [!code-cpp[System.IO.StringReaderWriter#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.io.stringwriter_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[System.IO.StringReaderWriter#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.io.stringwriter_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.IO.StringReaderWriter#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.io.stringwriter_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: public override void Close ();
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void Close() cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Closes the current and the underlying stream.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For an example of creating a file and writing text to a file, see [How to: Write Text to a File](../Topic/How%20to:%20Write%20Text%20to%20a%20File.md). For an example of reading text from a file, see [How to: Read Text from a File](../Topic/How%20to:%20Read%20Text%20from%20a%20File.md). For an example of reading from and writing to a binary file, see [How to: Read and Write to a Newly Created Data File](../Topic/How%20to:%20Read%20and%20Write%20to%20a%20Newly%20Created%20Data%20File.md).
This method overrides <xref:System.IO.Stream.Close%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
This implementation of `Close` calls the <xref:System.IO.StringWriter.Dispose%2A> method passing a `true` value.
Flushing the stream will not flush its underlying encoder unless you explicitly call `Close`. Setting <xref:System.IO.StreamWriter.AutoFlush%2A> to `true` means that data will be flushed from the buffer to the stream, but the encoder state will not be flushed. This allows the encoder to keep its state (partial characters) so that it can encode the next block of characters correctly. This scenario affects UTF8 and UTF7 where certain characters can only be encoded after the encoder receives the adjacent character or characters.
## Examples This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.IO.StringWriter.%23ctor%28System.Text.StringBuilder%29> constructor.
[!code-cs[System.IO.StringWriter3#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.io.stringwriter_3_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.IO.StringWriter3#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.io.stringwriter_3_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[System.IO.StringWriter3#2](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/m-system.io.stringwriter_3_1.cpp)]

.method familyhidebysig virtual instance void Dispose(bool disposing) cil managed

Docs.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the and optionally releases the managed resources.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When the `disposing` parameter is `true`, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this <xref:System.IO.StringWriter> references. This method invokes the `Dispose` method of each referenced object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is necessary for some XML scenarios where a header must be written containing the encoding used by the `StringWriter`. This allows the XML code to consume an arbitrary `StringWriter` and generate the correct XML header.
The following table lists examples of other typical or related I/O tasks.
|To do this...|See the example in this topic...| |-------------------|--------------------------------------| |Create a text file.|[How to: Write Text to a File](../Topic/How%20to:%20Write%20Text%20to%20a%20File.md)| |Write to a text file.|[How to: Write Text to a File](../Topic/How%20to:%20Write%20Text%20to%20a%20File.md)| |Read from a text file.|[How to: Read Text from a File](../Topic/How%20to:%20Read%20Text%20from%20a%20File.md)|

## Remarks The line terminator is defined by the <xref:System.IO.TextWriter.NewLine%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
## Examples The following example shows how to write characters by using the WriteLineAsync method.
[!code-cs[System.IO.StringWriter#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.io.stringwriter_4_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.IO.StringWriter#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.io.stringwriter_4_1.vb)]

Docs.exception: The string writer is currently in use by a previous write operation.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Threading.Tasks.Task WriteLineAsync (string value);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task WriteLineAsync(string value) cil managed

Docs.param: The string to write. If the value is , only a line terminator is written.
Docs.summary: Writes a string followed by a line terminator asynchronously to the current string.
Docs.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous write operation.

remarks.format:

.method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task WriteLineAsync(char[] buffer, int32 index, int32 count) cil managed

Docs.param: The character array to write data from.
The position in the buffer at which to start reading data.
The maximum number of characters to write.
Docs.summary: Writes a subarray of characters followed by a line terminator asynchronously to the string.
Docs.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous write operation.
